publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

msContents.summary:
I) Sinodos (fols. 1ra-182vb) I-1) Index of the Statutes or Commandments (tǝʾǝzazat) of the Apostles (fols. 1ra-2vb) I-2) Statutes or Commandments (tǝʾǝzazat) of the Apostles (fols. 3ra-40vb) I-3) Canons of Simon the Canaanite (n°2) (fols. 41ra-49rb) I-4) Canons of Simon the Canaanite (n°1) (fols. 49va-57rb) I-5) Apostolic Canons: 56 canons (fols. 57va-63ra) I-6) Canons after the Ascension of Our Lord (fols. 63ra-68rb) I-7) Apostolic Canons: 81 ʾabṭǝlisat (n°1) (fols. 68va-77va) I-8) Apostolic Canons: 81 ʾabṭǝlisat (n°2) (fols. 77vb-87ra) I-9) Apostolic Canons: 81 canons (fols. 87rb-91vb) I-10) Letter of Peter to Clement (fols. 92ra-95vb) I-11) Epistle 70 by Cyprian of Carthage (fols. 95vb-97ra) I-12) Melkite Index (fols. 97rb-97vb) I-13) Canons of the Council of Ancyra (fols. 97vb-101vb) I-14) Canons of the Council of Neocaesarea (fols. 101vb-104ra) I-15) Canons of the Council of Gangra (fols. 104ra-105vb) I-16) Canons of the Council of Sardica (fols. 105vb-108vb) I-17) Canons of the Council of Antioch (fols. 108rb-112va) I-18) Canons of the Council of Laodicea (fols. 112vb-119ra) I-19) Canons of the Council of Nicaea (20) (fols. 119rb-123va) I-20) Canons of the Council of Nicaea (84) (fols. 123vb-136vb) I-21) Discourse of the 318 Nicene Fathers on the Right Faith and on the Monastic Life (fols. 137ra-140ra) I-22) Ṣalota Hāymānot “Creed of Nicaea” (fols. 140rb-140vb) I-23) Interpretation of the Ten Commandments by John Chrysostom (fols. 141ra-148ra) I-24) Exposition and admonition on the Role of Our Lord in Our Salvation (also called On the Essence of the Holy Trinity) (fols. 148ra-150ra) I-25) Exposition and admonition on the Way of Virtue and Perdition (also called How to Distinguish between God and Evil) (fols. 150ra-150vb) I-26) Exposition and admonition on the Fear of God (fols. 150vb-155rb) I-27) Exposition and admonition on not Associating with Jews (also called On the Former People of God) (fols. 155vb-163rb) I-28) Exposition and admonition of Gregory of Armenia against the Jews (fols. 163ra-166vb) I-29) Exposition and admonition to Believers on Wise Conduct (fols. 167ra-178ra) I-30) Penitential Canons Given to St Peter (fols. 178rb-182vb)
Additiones 1-11; colophon.

msItem.incipit: f. 1ra, l. 1 በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወልድ፡ ወመልድ[sic]፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አሐዱ፡ አምላክ። ንቅድም፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ በሠናይ፡ ኅብረት፡ ወበጽሕፈተ፡ ሲኖዶስ፡ ዘአብው፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ዘሠርዑ፡ ለአርትዖ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስዲያን፡ ቅድስት። አሕብሮተ፡ ሲኖዶስ፡ ዘአበው፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ኅሩያን።

Index of the Statutes or Commandments of the Apostles): In the name of the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Spirit, one God. With the help of God, we begin with the good collection, with the writing of of Sinodos of fathers, the Apostles, which they established for the guidance of the holy Church. The gathering of the Sinodos of the fathers, the chosen Apostles.
msItem.explicit: f. 182vb, l.25 ኦኤጲስ፡ ቆጶሳት፡ ወከመዝ፡ ሥርዑ፡ ወሐግጉ። ሥርዓተ፡ ንስሐ፡ ከመ፡ ኢይሙት፡ ኀጥእ፡ በኀጢአቱ። ሀብዎሙ፡ ንሥሐ፡ ለእለ፡ ይፈቅዱ፡ ይነስሑ።

Penitential Canons Given to St. Peter:): O bishops, prescribe and legislate the order of penance in this way, so that the sinner does not die in his sins. Give penance to those who want (it), let them repent.

msItem.incipit: ሲኖዶስ ፡ ዘአው ፡ (sic) ቅዱሳን ፡ ሐዋርያት ፡ ዘሠርዑ ፡ ለአርትዖ ፡ ቤተ ፡ ክርስቲያን ፡ ቅድስት ፡ አኀብ ሮተ ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ ዘአበው ፡ ሐዋርያት ፡ ኀሩያን ፡ ላዕለ፡ መርሐ ፡ (sic) ግብረ ፡ አናቅጽ ፡ ወላዕሌሃ ፡ ኆልቊ ፡ ይቀልል ፡ ክመ ፡ አውፅአ ፡ ትእዛዝ ፡ ወፍትሐ ፡ በውእቱ ። ወላዕለ ፡ ኲሉ ፡ ምቅቀ ም፡ ክመ ፡ ኍልቆ ፡ አናቅጽ ። ይእቲ ፡ ፻፳ወ፯ አናቅጸ ፡ ኍልቁ ፡ ወቦ ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ እምኔሃ ፡ ዘቤተ ፡ ክርስቲያን ፡ ዘወሀቡ ፡ ሐቀርያት ፡ በ እዶ ፡ ቀሌምንጦስ ፡ ዘለአኩ ፡ ቀዲሙ ፡ ወይ እቲ ፡ ፶ወ፯አናቅጽ ።። ቀደሚ ፡ ክስተተ ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ ዘሐዋርያት ፡ ቅዱሳን ፡ ፸ወ፪አናቅጹ ።
msItem.note: Here follows a list of seventy-three (sic) titloi.

msItem.incipit: ወእምኔሃ ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ ዘቤተ ፡ ክርስቲያን ፡ ዘወሀብዋ ፡ ሐዋርያት ፡ ካዕበ ፡ በዕደ ፡ ቀሌምንጦስ ፡ ዘለአኩ ፡ ቀዲ ሙ ፡ ወይእቲ ፡ ፶ወ፯አናቅጽ ፡ ኆልቊ።
other Orders of the Apostles, given through Clement, fifty-seven in number
msItem.note: The list of titloi enumerates only fifty-six.

msItem.incipit: ሲኖዶስ ፡ ዘአበው ፡ ሐዋርያት ፡ ዘሠርዑ ፡ ለአርትዖ ፡ ቤተ ፡ ክርስቲያን ።
ዝንቱ ፡ ቀኖና ፡ ዘአበው ፡ ሐዋርያት ፡ ንጹሓን ፡ ወቅዱሳን ፡
ሥርዓተ ፡ ክህነት ፡ ዘስምዖን ፡ ቊናዊ ፡ በእንተ ፡ ሥርዓተ ፡ ክርስታያን ፡ ቅድስት ።
በእንተ ፡ ዓሥራት ፡ ወበኲር ።
ወአዘዘ ፡ ጳወሎስ ፡ ሐዋርያ ፡ ወይቤ ፡ ኲሉ ፡ መሃይምን ፡ ወመሐይምንት ፡ ሶበ ፡ ይክውን ፡ ጽባሐ ፡ ኢይግበሩ ፡ ግብረ ፡ ዘእንበለ ፡ ይትሐፀቡ ፡ እደዊሆሙ ፡ ወይጸል ዩ ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር ፡ ፈጣሪሆሙ ፡ etc.
በእንተ ፡ ዕረፍተ ፡ አግብርት ፡ በዕለታት ፡ ዘይደሉ ።
በእንተ ፡ ዓቀበ ፡ ጊዜ ፡ አ ቅዱሙ ፡ ጸሎተ ።
በእንተ ፡ እለ ፡ ኖሙ ፡ ዘክመ ፡ ይትገበር ፡ ተዝካር ።
ወካዕበ ፡ በእንተ ፡ እለ ፡ ተጸውዑ ፡ ውስተ ፡ ምሳሕ ፡ ወተዝካረ ፡ ሙታን ።
ወካዕበ ፡ ነገሮሙ ፡ በእንተ ፡ እለ ፡ ይስደዱ ፡ በእንተ ፡ ሃይማኖት ፡ ወይጐዩ ፡ እምሀር ፡ ውስተ ፡ ሀገር ።
በእንተ ፡ ዓቀበ ፡ መዓርገ ፡ ክህነት ።
ትእዛዝ ፡ ወቀኖና ፡ ዘጳውሎስ ፡ ላእክ ፡ በእንተ ፡ እለ ፡ ይመጽኡ ፡ ኀበ ፡ ምሥጢርነ ፡ ሐዲሳን ፡ ወባእደንሂ ።
ዝንቱ ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ ዘሐዋርያት ፡ ቅዱሳን ፡ ዘነገረ ፡ ቀሌምንጦስ ፡ ወይእቲ ፡ በጥልሳት ፡ ዘኀበሩ ፡ ባቲ ፡ አርደኢሁ ፡ ለእግዚእነ ፡ ኢየሱስ ፡ ክርስትስ ፡ ወኍልቆሙ ፡ ፹ወ፩ትእዛዝ ።
msItem.note: Canons of the Apostles, given through Clement, eighty-one in number

msItem.incipit: ሲኖዶስ ፡ ዘቤተ ፡ ክርስቲያን ፡ ዘወሁበዎ ፡ ሐዋርያ ት ፡ በእደ ፡ ቀሌምንጦስ ፡ ቀዲሙ ፡ ዘለአክዎ።
msItem.note: Canons of the Apostles, given through Clement, fifty-six in number

msItem.incipit: ዘቲ ፡ ያእቲ^ ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ ዘሐዋርያት ፡ ቅዱሳት ፡ ወይእቲ ፡ ዘ ዜነወ ፡ ቀሌምንጦስ ፡ በእንተ ፡ ጴጥሮስ ፡ መምህሩ ፡ ወይቲ ፡ ትሠመይ ፡ እልበጥልሳት ፡ ዘተጋብኡ^ ፡ ላዕሌ ሃ ፡ ሐዋርያቲሁ ፡ ለእግዚእነ ፡ ኢየሱስ ፡ ክር ስቶስ ። ወኍልቆሙ ፡ ፹ወ፩እብሊስ ።
msItem.note: Canons of the Apostles called titloi, eighty-one in number

msItem.incipit: ዝንቱ ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ ዘአበው ፡ ሐዋርያት ፡ ንጹሓን ፡ ወቅዱሳን ።
msItem.note: Canons of the Apostles, twenty-five in number, almost identical with those given above under no. 2

msItem.incipit: ዝነቱ ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ መጽሐፈ ፡ ዜናሆሙ ፡ ለሐዋ ርያት ፡ እምድኀረ ፡ ዓርገ ፡ እግዚእነ ፡ ወአምላ ክነ ፡ ኢየሱስ ፡ ክርስቶስ ፡ ዘአዘዙ ፡ በሲኖዶ ስ ፡ ዘጸሐፈ ፡ ቀሌምንጦስ ።
msItem.note: Canons of the Apostles, after the Ascension of our Lord, thirty in number

msItem.incipit: ዝንቱ ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ ቅዱስ ፡ ሥርዓተ ፡ ሐዋርያቱ ፡ ምስለ ፡ ቀሌምንጦስ ፡ ዘተፈነወ ፡ ለአሐዛብ ፡ ሕገ ፡ ቤተ ፡ ክርስቲያን ።
msItem.note: Canons of the Apostles, seventy-nine in number

msItem.incipit: ዝንቱ ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ ዘቀሌምንጦስ ፡ ዘጸሐፈ ፡ ጴጥሮስ ፡ ረድእ ፡ ወርእስ ፡ ሐዋርያት ፡ ዘነገረ ፡ በእንተ ፡ እግዚ እነ ፡ ኢየሱስ ፡ ክርስቶስ ፡ ደቤ፡ ቀሌምንጦስ ፡ ዘእምጴጥሮስ ፡ ርእስ ፡ ሐዋርያት ፡ ረድኡ ፡ ለእግዚእነ ፡ ኢየሱስ ፡ ክርስቶስ ። Beginning, ወይቤሎሙ ፡ ወልድየ ፡ ቀሌምንጦስ ፡ ኢታጥ ምቅ ፡ መነሂ ፡ በሕልያን ፡ ወምቱር ፡ ላዕለ ፡ ጥምቀት ፡ ወዘነሥአ ፡ ሕልያነ ፡ በሤጥ ፡ ምቱ ር ፡ ውእቱ ፡ ወውጉዝ ፡ ወርጉም ፡ እምአፉየ ፡ አነ ፡ ጴጥሮስ ፡ ንኡስ ፡ እምሐዋርያት ፡ ወመ ክፈልቱ ፡ ይኩን ፡ ምስለ ፡ ሴምን ፡ መሰርይ ፡ ወይሁደ ፡ ረሲዕ ።
msItem.note: Canons of Clement, which he received in a letter from S. Peter
msItem.colophon: ወፈጸምና ፡ ለዛቲ ፡ መጽሐፈ ፡ ሐዋርያት ፡ በሰለም ፡ አሜን ።

msItem.incipit: ዘንቱ ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ ዘማኀበረ፡ ቅዱሳን ፡ ፫፻፲ወ፰ዘሠር ዑ ፡ በኒቅያ ፡ ፳ቀናና ።
msItem.note: Titles of the Canons of the Council of Nicaea 1 (the canons are twenty in number, though the titloi enumerate twenty-two)
Canons of the Council of Nicaea, twenty in number

msItem.incipit: ዝንቱ ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ ዘ፫፻፲ ወ፰ርቱዓነ ፡ ሃይሜኖት ፡ ዘሠርዑ ፡ ማኀበረዓቢይ ።
msItem.note: Titles of the Canons of the Council of Nicaea 2 (the canons are eighty-four in number, though the titloi vary).

msItem.incipit: ዝንቱ ፡ ሣህል ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ እለ ፡ ተጋብአ ፡ በግንግራን ፡ ኤጲስ ፡ ቆጶሳት ፡ ወሠርዑ ፡ ፳ትእዛዝ ።
msItem.note: Titles of the Canons of the Council of Gangra (the canons are twenty in number, though the titloi give twenty-one).

msItem.incipit: ዝንቱ ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ ዘጉባዔ ፡ ስርድቀ ፡ ውኖ ልቆሙ ፡ ፻ወ፵ኤጲስ ፡ ቆጶሳት ፡ ወሠርዑ ፡ ዕሥራ ፡ ወ፩ተ ፡ ትእዛዘ ፡ ተጋቢኦሙ ፡ እም ርኁቅ ፡ በሓውርት ።
msItem.note: Canons of the Council of Sardes, twenty-one in number

msItem.incipit: ዝንቱ ፡ ሲኖዶስ ፡ ዘማኀበረ ፡ አንጾኪያ ፡ ወኍ ልቆሙ ፡ ፲፫ኤጲስ ፡ ቆጶሳት ፡ ወሠርዑ ፡ ፳፭ ትእዛዝ ።
msItem.note: Titles of the Canons of the Council of Antioch (the canons are twenty-five in number, though the titloi give only twenty-three).

msItem.incipit: ትርጓሜ ፡ ዓሠርቱ ፡ ቃላት ፡ ዘተርጉመ ፡ ዩሐንስ ፡ አፈ ፡ ወርቅ ፡ ሊቀ ፡ ጳጳሳት ፡ ዘቍስጥንጥንያ ፡ ሀገር ፡ በእንተ ፡ ዓሠርቱ ፡ ቃላት ፡ ዘነበበ ፡ እግ ዚአብሔር ፡ ለሙሴ ፡ በድበረ ፡ ሲና ። ወእምድኀረዝ ፡ አይደእኩ፡ ኦፍቁር ፡ ስብ ሐተ ፡ ክርስቶስ ፡ ዘአልቦ ፡ ኁልቁ ፡ በዘ ፡ ኢይትኈልቍ ፡ እስክ ፡ ለዓለም ።

ግጻዌ ፡ ትምህርት ፡ ሕግ ፡ ወሥርዓት ፡ ወተግሣጽ ፡ ዘተሠርዓ ፡ በዕለተ ፡ ህሉና ፡ አብ ፡ ወወልድ ፡ ወመንፈስ ፡ ቅዱስ ፡ ዘይትነ በብ ፡ ወትረ ፡ ላዕለ ፡ ሕዝብ ፡ ወህላዌ ፡ መለኮቱ ዘኢይትነገር ፡ ወዘኢይትሌለይ ፡ ወኢይትፈ ለጥ ፡ ወኀብረተ ፡ ቃል ፡ ዘእምቅድስተ ፡ ሥላ ሴ ፡ ይእቲ ፡ እንተ ፡ ክርስቶስ ፡ ሕሊና ፡ ታህሉ፡ ምስሌነ ፡ አሜን ።
ግጻዌ ፡ ትምህርት ፡ ከመ ፡ ይፍልጡ ፡ ሠናየ ፡ ወእኩየ ።
ግጻዌ ፡ ትምህርት ፡ አብስልጢሳት ፡ ቀናና ፡ በእንት ፡ ፍርሃት ፡ እግ ዚአብሔር ።
ትምህርት ፡ ወትግሣጹ ፡ በእንት ፡ ቀደሚ ፡ ሕዝብ ፡ ወዝልፈት ፡ እስራ ኤል ።

ግጻዌ ፡ ወትግሣጹ ፡ አብ ሰልጢስ ፡ ቀናና ፡ በእንት ፡ ዘዘለፎሙ ፡ ወገሠ ጾሙ ፡ ወአስትሐፈሮሙ ፡ ቅዱስ ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ ፡ ሊቀ ፡ ጳጳሳት ፡ ዘአርማንያ ፡ ገሠጾሙ ፡ ወዘ ለፎሙ ፡ ለአይሁድ ፡ እኩያን ፡ ሀለዉ ፡ ህየ ፡ ምስሌሁ ፡ ቅዱስ ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ ፡ በእንት ፡ እለ ፡ ይብሉ ፡ ዘተወልደ ፡ እማርያም ፡ ኢኮነ ፡ ወልደ ፡ እግ ዚአብሔር ፡ አለ ፡ ሰብእ ፡ አላ ፡ ወልደ ፡ ሰብእ ።

ግጹው ፡ ወሥርዓት ፡ ትምህርት ፡ ወጥበብ ፡ ወተግሣጽ፡ አብሰልጢስ ፡ ቀናና ፡ ዘተሠርዓ ፡ ለእለ ፡ የአምኑ ፡ በሕሉና ፡ እግ ዚአብሔር ፡ ወእለ ፡ ይፈቅዱ ፡ ይስምዑ ፡ ትምህርተ ፡ ጽድቅ ፡ ወይሖሩ ፡ በጥበብ ፡ ወበአ እምሮ ፡ ወበለብዎ ፡ በፍናዋተ ፡ ጽድቅ ፡ ወሐ ይወት ፡ ወይግበሩ ፡ ፍሬ ፡ ጽድቅ ፡ ዘይደልዋ ፡ ለነፍሰሙ ፡ ወያአምሩ ፡ ስርዋ ፡ ለጥበብ ፡ ወኅበሪሃ ። ጥበብ ፡ ትኄይስ ፡ እም ኵሉ ፡ መዛግብት ፡ ወምግባር ፡ ትበቍዕ ፡ እምኩሉ ፡ ብዕል ፡ ዘበምድር ፡ ጥበብ ፡ ዝእቤ ፡ አኮ ፡ ጥበበዝ ፡ ዓለም ።

አብስልጢስ ፡ ቀኖና፡ በእንት ፡ ንስሐ ፡ ትምህርት ፡ ዘተሠርዓ ፡ እምኅበ ፡ እግዚእነ ፡ ኢየሱስ ፡ ከርስትስ ፡ ወተስእሎ ፡ ጴጥሮስ ፡ ለእግዚእነ ፡ ኢየሱስ ፡ ከርስትስ ፡ እምድኅረ ፡ ተንሥአ ፡ እሙ^ትን ፡ በደብረ ፡ ዘይት ፡ ወይቤሎ ፡ ሊቅ ፡ ንግረነ ፡ ወአእመርነ ፡ ሥርዓተ ፡ ንስሐ ፡ ወዘይደሉ ፡ ከመ ፡ ንግር ወንምሀር ፡ ለሕዝብ ፡ ትምህርት ፡ ሕይወት ።
ነገር ፡ ዘቅዱሳን ፡ አበው ፡ ፫፻፲ወ፳ዘይከውን ፡ ሕንጸ ፡ ለመነኮሳት ። በእንተ ፡ ሥለሰ ፡ ቅድስት ፡ እምነትሙ ፡ እም ዛተ ፡ ቅድስት ፡ ሃይማናት ፡ እንት ፡ በኒቅያ ፡ ሀገር ፡ እምቅዱሳን ፡ እንት ፡ ለአለብዎትሙ ፡ ለየወብን ፡ ወለአእምሮ ።
ሲኖዶስ ፡ ዘአውከሳርያ ፡ ባት ፡ ትጋብኡ ፡ ፶ኤ ጲስ ፡ ቀጳሳት ፡ ወሥርዑ ፡ ሥርዓት ፡ ፲ወ፱ት እዛዝ
msItem.note: Titles of the Canons of the Council of Neocesarea
Canons of the Council of Neocesarea

msItem.colophon: ተፈጸመ ፡ በዝ የ ፡ ሲኖደ ሶሙ ፡ ለሐዋርያት ፡ ወለጳጳሳት ። ስብሐት ፡ ለእግዚአብሐር ፡ አብ ፡ ወለወልዱ ፡ ኢየሱስ ፡ ከርስትሰ ፡ etc.

msContents.colophon: 49rb, l.28: በአስተሐምሞ፡ በትእዛዘ። እግዚአብሔር፡ ገበርክዎ፡ ለዝንቱ፡ ነገር ። Written in hand c, cp. also Additiones 1, 4, 8, 10, 12. The note is written over erased punctuation sign.

supportDesc.extent: Made of 183 folios, of which 0.0 blank , in 25.0 quires . 370 270 115

1
B(1; s.l.: 1, stub after 1/fol. 183r-v) f. 183 added from a different Ms.

supportDesc.condition: Back board is broken and repaired with a piece of another board and wire rings. ff. 1-2 are crudely stitched to the Ms.; 183 is crudely stitched to the Ms. as an endleaf. 118-119 are of irregular size. The leather cover is of recent age. Leaves carefully amended: 48, 61, 105, 106, 176.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: four dot asterisk encircled with red line (20v, 37v).
chain of coronis signs, under the chain of nine dot asterisks with thin red and black lines in between (49r, 182vb).

handNote.seg: Numbers and incipit of canons; incipit of prayers; incipit of texts; elements of the punctuation signs.

decoNote.desc: drawing of a cross; black ink.
crude, recent drawing of a symbol; pencil.
two crude, recent drawings of the same symbol as in 70r; pencil.
crude, recent drawing of the same symbol as in 70r; pencil.
crude, recent drawing of a cross; pencil.
a drawing; pencil.
a drawing; black ink.
a drawing of a cross; black ink.
recent, elaborated drawing of a cross; pencil.
drawing of a cross; pencil.

wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-1), with three lateral extensions decorated with crosses, reaching the bottom of the text; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page(interlaces, crosses).

wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-2), with three lateral extensions decorated with crosses, reaching the bottom of the text; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page(interlaces, crosses).

wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-3), with three lateral pendants reaching l.6 whose the central one decorated with a cross; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page(interlaces, crosses).

wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-4), with three lateral pendants reaching l.11 for the left side one, l.9 for the central one and l.8 for the right side one, the left and right side ones decorated with a cross; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page(interlaces, crosses).

wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-5) with four pendants at the corners and two central pendants decorated with a cross, reaching l.5 and reaching the top of the page. The horizontal band extends to the top of the page. Palmettes.
simple, narrow, coloured (red), horizontal ornamental band in col. a, after l.14, at the incipit of text I.-6) with four pendants at the corners, reaching l.11 and l.19 (interlaces).

wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-7), with four pendants at the corners, and two central pendants decorated with crosses, reaching l.5 and reaching the top of the page. The horizontal band extends to the top of the page (interlaces, crosses).
narrow, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. b, at the incipit of text I.-8) with central cross extending to the top of the page (interlaces, crosses).

narrow, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. b, at the incipit of text I.-9), with central cross extending to the top of the page, and four pendants at the corners, reaching l.5 (interlaces).
wide, coloured (red and black), simple horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-10) (interlaces).
narrow, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. b, at the incipit of text I.-12), with central cross extends to the top of the page (interlaces, crosses).
simple, narrow, coloured (red and black, horizontal ornamental band in col. b after l.21, at the incipit of text I.-14), with four pendants at the corners reaching l.24 and l.18 (interlaces).
simple, narrow, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band in col. a, after l.11, at the incipit of text I.-15), with four pendants at the corners, reaching l.9 and l.14 (interlaces).
simple, narrow, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band in col. b, after l. 5, at the incipit of text I.-16), with four pendants at the corners, reaching l.2 and l.8 (interlaces).
simple, narrow, uncoloured, horizontal ornamental band in col. a, after l.18, after the index of text I.-17), with four pendants at the corners reaching l.15 and l.21. Geometric motifs (interlaces).

narrow, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. b, at the incipit of text I.-18), with four pendants at the corners reaching l. 4 and reaching the top of the page. The horizontal band extends to the top of the page. Geometric motifs (interlaces, cross).
narrow, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. b, at the incipit of text I.-19), extending to the top of the page. Geometric motifs (interlaces, crosses, palmettes).

narrow, coloured (red), horizontal ornamental band over col. b, at the incipit of text I.-20), with four pendants at the corners reaching l.3 and reaching the top of the page. The horizontal band extends to the top of the page. Geometric motifs (interlaces, cross, palmettes).

wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-21), with four pendants at the corners decorated with crosses, and two central pendants decorated with crosses, reaching l.3 and the top of the page. The horizontal band extends to the top of the page with pairs of ailes. Geometric motifs (interlaces, crosses).
simple, wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-23). Geometric motifs (interlaces, crosses).
simple, wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. A-b, at the incipit of text I.-27). Geometric motifs (interlaces).

wide, coloured (red and black), horizontal ornamental band over col. a-b, at the incipit of text I.-29), with three lateral extension whose the central one decorated with a cross, reaching l. 7; The horizontal band extends to the top of the page. Geometric motifs (interlaces, crosses).

item.quote: 40vb, l.30: አጥረይክዋ፡ አነ፡ ገበረ፡ መድኅን፡ በመን{ፈ}ሰ፡ ጥበብ፡
[40vb, l.30] I acquired it (this book), Gabra Madḫǝn, through the spirit of wisdom.
item.note: Hand c; cp. also Additiones 2, 4, 8, 10, 12; written over erasure.

item.quote: 40vb, l.32: ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘደብረ፡ ዓለማ፡ ይእቲ፡ አሽር፡ መተራ፡ ደብረ፡ ሎዛ፡ ይወርዱ፡ ባቲ፡ መላእክላት፡ ውስተ፡ ዛቲ፡ መካን፡ የዓውድዋ፡ በክብር፡ ወበስብሐት፡ ማእከላ፡ ገነት፡ ዳሯ፡ እሳት።

[40vb, l.32] This book belongs to Dabra ʿālama ʿAšir Mätära Dabra Lozza. Through it, the angels come down, to this place, and they go around it with glory and praise. Paradise is in its middle, fire are its margins.
item.note: Hand d; s. also Additiones nos. 6, 9.

item.desc: l.15-17: Short praise for Däbrä ʿālama ʿAšir Mätära.
item.quote: 58ra, l.15-17: ደብረ፡ ዓለማ፡ ይእቲ፡ አሽር፡ መተራ፡ ማእከላ፡ ገነት፡ ዳሯ፡ እሳት።
[58ra, l.15-17] Dabra ʿālama, which is ʿAšǝr Mätära, its middle is paradise, its margin is fire.

item.desc: : Exhortation to the priests to read the book of Senodos.
item.quote: 68rb, l.28: ኦካህናት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡ ኢትጽርዑ፡ አንብቦ፡ መጸሕፍት። ወአዕርጎ፡ ቊርባን፡ ለሕዝብ፡ በበ፡ ሰናብት። {ዘተሣየጥክዋ፡} ለዛቲ፡ ሲኖዶስ፡ {አነ፡ ካህን፡} በእንተ፡ ፍቅሮሙ፡ ለሐዋያት[sic]፡ ወበእንተ፡ ፍቅራ፡ ለማርያም።

[68rb, l.28] O priests and deacons, do not be idle at reading books, and celebrating the Eucharist for the people on Sabbath-days. I bought this Sinodos, the priest, for the sake of the love of Apostles and for the sake of the love of Mary.
item.note: Hand a; s. also Additiones 7, 14. The passage is in fact the conclusion of text I-6, but it was turned into an acquisition note a by means of adding ዘተሣየጥክዋ፡ and አነ፡ ካህን፡ (hand c), written over a few erased words.

item.quote: 77va, l.28: ስብሐት፡ ለአብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ። ዘኀ[er.]ሀለይኩ፡ ወዘተመነይኩ፡ ረከብኩ፡ ለቀድሶ፡ ነፍስ፡ ወሥጋ፡ ሕሊና፡ መፍቅድየ።
[77va, l.28] Glory be to the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit. I have obtained what I thought of and what I desired, for sanctifying of soul and body; intelligence is what I need...

item.desc: : Admonition concerning the canon regulations on the main church feasts and Baptism.
item.quote: 87ra, l.12: ወኀልቈ፡ በዓላቲሁስ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ዐበይት፡ በዓላት፡ ፱ቱ፡ ጽንሰቱ፡ ልደቱ፡ ግዝረቱ፡ ጥምቀቱ፡ ስቅለቱ፡ ትንሣኤሁ፡ እርገቱ፡ በዐለ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ደብረ፡ ታቦር፡ ልደተ፡ ሰምዖን፡ ከግዝረት፡ እሩይ። ጥምቀትስ፡ ሕግ፡ መሲሐዊት፡ ወሕግ፡ መንፈሳዊት፡ ጥምቀትስ፡ ለኵሉ፡ ተሠርዓት፡ ለእደው፡ ወለአንስት፡ ኢይትወከፋ፡ እደው፡ አንስተ፡ ወአንስት፡ አደወ፡ ዘውእቱ፡ አባልጅ፡ ወኢይግበሩ፡ ተዋሰቦ፡ ምስለ፡ ዘተሐበዮ፡ አሁሆሙ፡ ወምስለ፡ ዘተርፋ፡ ነገዱ፡ ለነሳኢ፡ ወለተነሣኢ፡ ውጉዝ፡ በቃለ፡ ፲ወ፩ሐዋርያት። ወአንትሙ፡ ካህናት፡ አጥምቁ፡ አንሰተ፡ በ፹ዕለት፡ ወዕደወ፡ በ፵ዕለት፡ ኢታትርፋ፡ ወኢታሕልፋ። ለእመኮነ፡ ጥምቅት፡ በሰኑይ፡ ኢትብልዑ፡ ቅብዐ፡ እለ፡ ብልዑ፡ ዘይትበላዕ፡ በፆም፡ በዕለተ፡ ቀዳሚት፡ ሰንበት።

[87ra, l.12] And the number of the feasts of Our Lord is nine great feasts: His Conception, His Birth, His Circumcision, His Baptism, His Crucifixion, His Resurrection, His Ascension, the feast of the Holy Spirit, Dabra Tabor. The birth of Simon is equivalent to the Circumcision. Baptism is the Christian law, and the spiritual law. Baptism is established for all, for men and women. The women should not accept the men, and the men (should not accept) the women who are ʾabbalǝğ (?). And they should not make marriage with their (god) father who took charge of it, and with the rest of his lineage – neither the one who baptizes, nor the one who is being baptized (?). I t is prohibited by the word of the 12 Apostles. And you, priests, baptize woman on the 80th day and men on the 40th day. Do not leave and do not transgress (this regulation). When it is Baptism, do not eat butter on the second day (Monday) but eat what is eaten on fasting days, on the day of the first Sabbath.
item.note: Hand e; s. also Additio 13. The term ʾabbalǝğ probably refers to god-children of the same god-father.

item.quote: 91vc, l.1: ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘትግሬ፡ መኰንን፡ አከሎም፡ ዘከለላ፡ ወገደማ፡ ወወሀባ፡ ለማርያም፡ አሽር፡ መትራ፡ ይእቲ፡ ደብረ፡ ዓለማ፡ ወኦዳ፡ በንፍሐተ፡ ቀርን፡ ምስለ፡ ጳጳስ፡ አባ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ዘወሀቦ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ዘርዓ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ለትግሬ፡ መኰንን፡ አከሎም፡ በዘበነ[sic]፡ አባ፡ ይስሐቅ፡ አበ፡ ምኔት። ወበዘበነ[sic]፡ አቡነ፡ አበከረዙነ[sic]።

[91vc, l.1] This book (is) of tǝgre makʷannǝn ʾAkkälom who delimited the precinct and established as monastery and donated (the book) to St Mary of ʾAšǝr Mätǝra, which is Dabra ʿālama; and he went around with the blowing of the trumpet, together with Bishop (ṗaṗṗas) ʾabbā Yoḥannǝs whom our King Zarʾa Yāʿqob gave to tǝgre makʷannǝn ʾAkkälom, in the time of ʾabbā Yǝsḥaq, the abbot, and ʾabuna Abäkäräzun.
item.note: Hand d; s. also Additiones 2, 9. The note is written in a secondary, later hand 18th or 19th cent. (?).

item.quote: 97ra, l.29: ኦቀሰውሳት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡ ለእመ፡ ኢማሃርክምዎሙ[sic]፡ በበ፡ ሰናብት፡ በዝንቱ፡ ሲኖዶስ። ትወርዱ፡ ውስተ፡ መቅሠፍት። ወኢታጽርዑ፡ መሥዋዕተ፡ በበ፡ ሰናብት።

[97ra, l.29] O priests and deacons, if you don't teach them each Sabbath day according to this Sinodos, you will descent into the punishment. And you do not be idle at (celebrating) the Mass at Sabbath days!
112va, l.24: በእንተ፡ ጸሎቶሙ፡ ለሐዋርያት፡ ወበእንተ፡ ማኅበረ፡ ርቱዓነ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ወበእንተ፡ ኵሎን፡ አብያተ፡ ክርስቲያናት፡ ይምሐረኒ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ አመ፡ ዕለተ፡ ፍዶ[sic]፡ ወቅስት፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን።

[112va, l.24] For the sake of the prayer of the Apostles, and for the sake of the assembly of those Righteous of Faith, and for the sake of all Churches, Christ have mercy upon us on the day of repayment (?) and judgement. Amen and amen.
item.note: Hand c, cp. also Additiones 1, 3, 4, 10, 12. Similar to Addition 4, this note is written over an erased passage of the original text (by hand a), of which only the last two words were retained ("Amen and amen").

item.desc: : A list of the monastery's gwǝlt-possessions.
item.quote: 112va, l.31: ዛቲ፡ ገዳም፡ መካነ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ እንተ፡ ትሰመይ፡ ደብረ፡ ዓለማ፡ ጉልታ፡ መንበርታ፡ ዴሥአ፡ ሰንአፌ፡ ፯ሀገር፡ ነው። ተዝካር፡ ያወጣ፡ ፊሪዳ።

[112va, l.31] This monastery is the place of saints which is called Dabra ʿālama. Its gwǝlt-possessions are (in) Mänbärta, Desʾa (and) Sänʾafe, seven lands. For the commemoration feat, each brings a calf.
item.note: Hand d; s. also Addition 2, 6; Partly in Amharic.

item.quote: 123va, l.26: ምሥጢር፡ ኅቡእ፡ ዘተከሥት፡ በቅዱሳን፡ ዘኤንሶን፡ ወዘአናቶን፡ ይምልአኒ፡ ፍርቃን፡ ወኢይርከበኒ፡ ኀዘን፡ ወእስከ፡ ምጽአቱ፡ ለመድኅን፡ አሜን። ለይኵን። መሢሕየ፡ አኤናዎን፡ ያርፍቀኒ፡ ውስተ፡ ምሳሀ፡ ደብረ፡ ጽዮን። አሜን።

[Fol: 123va, l.26] The hidden mystery which was revealed by saints [?] and [?], it fill up me with salvation and it does not gives me sadness; and until the arrival of the savior, amen, and of his rule, it [?] me [?] it invite me to the table of Dabra Ṣǝyon, amen.
item.note: Hand c; s. also add. nos. 1, 3, 5, 8, 12; Written over erased punctuation sign.

item.quote: 140va, l.15: አንቀጽ፡ በእንተ፡ አጽዋማት። ቀዳሚ፡ ፆመ፡ አምላክ፡ ወዳግመ፡ ፆመ፡ ድሕነት፡ ወአርብ፡ ወጾመ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ወፆመ፡ ነቢያት፡ ወገሐድ፡ ዘልደት፡ ገሐድ፡ ዘጥምቀት፡ ፆመ፡ ነነዌ፡ ጥምቀት፡ ለእመ፡ ኮነ፡ በሰኑይ፡ በዕለት፡ ቀዳሚት፡ ወዕሁድ፡ ኢትብልዑ፡ ሥጋ፡ ወቅብአ፡ አላ፡ ብልዑ፡ ዘይትበላዕ፡ በዐቢይ፡ ፆም፡ ዘወጽአ፡ እምዝንቱ፡ ሕግ፡ ርጉም፡ ወውጉዝ፡ ውእቱ፡ ይቤሉ፡ ሐዎርያት፡ በሲኖዶሶሙ።

[140va, l.15] First, fast of God and secondly, fast of the salvation, and fourthly, fast of the Apostles and fast of the Prophets, and on the eve of Nativity and on the eve of Epiphany, fast of Nänäwé, if Epiphany is on the second day of the week, the first day, or Sunday, meat and oil will not be eaten but eat what is it eaten during the great fast which started from this cursed rule and averted, as the Apostles said in their Sinodos.
140vb, l.11: አዚዝ፡ መንፈስ፡ እምከቢት፡ ወእስከ፡ ሐዲሰ፡ ወእስከ፡ ትበሊ፡ የብስ፡ ከበደ፡ አበላ፡ ለይደመስስ።
item.note: Hand c; s. also add. nos. 1, 3, 4, 8, 10; Written over erased punctuation signs.

list.item:
f. 140vb, l.14 : Foundation charter of Dabra ʿālama ʿAšǝr Mätära.
140vb, l.14: ንጽሕፍ፡ ሥርዓተ፡ አበው፡ ዘአስተናበሩ፡ አበው፡ ቅዱሳን፡ እለ፡ በደብር፡ ወበአታት፡ በዘመነ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ። ወበዘመነ፡ ጳጳሳቲነ፡ አባ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወአባ፡ ገብርኤል፡ እምአመ፡ ተሐድገ፡ መንበረ፡ ነገሥተ፡ አክሱም፡ ተሐደሰ፡ በ፹ወ፯አመተ፡ ምሕረት፡ በዘመነ፡ ማቴዎስ፡ ወንጌላዊ፡ ጕልታ፡ ሠንአፌ፡ ፲ሀገር፡ መንበርታ፡ ዴስአ፡ ነው፡ አስራት፡ በኵራት፡ ቆብ፡ ብይን፡ ተሰካር፡ ዋርሳ፡ በርሰዋ፡ ይታዘዝ፡ ብለው፡ አውግዘዋል። አሺርመትራ፡ ማዕከላ፡ ገነት፡ ዳሯ፡ እሳት፡ ትኩን፡ ብለው፡ ከመ፡ ኢይግብዑ፡ ሰብ፡ በሥልጣነ፡ አብ፡ ወወል [ድ] ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ ተጽሕፈ፡ በዘመነ፡ አቡነ፡ አበከረዙን። [140vb, l.14] We copied the ordinances of Fathers set in order by saint Fathers who were in the convent and removed, in the time of our king Zarʾa Yāʿqob. And in the time of metropolitans ʾabbā Mikāʾel and ʾabbā Gabrǝʾel, since it was abandoned, the throne of kings of Aksum, it was restored, in the 87th year of mercy [1435 A.D.], during the time of Matewos the evangelist [blank line] The gwult is in Sänʾafe, 10 lands, in Mänbärta and Desʾa, the ʾasrat (…) Ašir Mätǝra [blank line] Paradise is in its middle, fire are its margins (...) Hand e; s. also add. no. 5; In red ink; line 10, 16, and partly 20 are washed out.

item.quote: 166vb, l.27: ለጸሐፊሃ፡ ስረዩ፡ ወባርኩ፡ ወዘገደፍኩ፡ አርትዑ፡ በቃልክሙ፡ ኦካህናቲሁ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ያብርህ፡ አዕይንተ፡ ልብክሙ። (blank line) ፡ በእንተ፡ ፍቅሮሙ፡ ለሐዋርያት። ወበእንተ፡ ፍቅሮሙ፡ ለአርድእት፡ ይጽሐፍ፡ ስሞ፡ ኀበ፡ ዓምደ፡ ወርቅ፡ በሰማያት።

[166vb, l.27] For your scribe, forgive him and bless him, I rejected what they declared right by their voice, O priests of God, He illumines the eyes of your heart [blank line] thanks to the love of the Apostles and thanks to the love of the assistants, he wrote his name near to the golden column in the skies.

binding.decoNote: Wooden boards (recently) covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Four pairs of sewing stations.
Parchment guards (possibly of the same origin as 183) were used to sew together fols. 1-2.

origin.origDate: Second half of the 15th - mid 16th century (?). Additio 7 refers to the role of King Zarʾa Yāʿqob (r. 1434-68) and Bishop (here called ṗāṗās) Yoḥannǝs in the foundation of the monastery, but it is written in a later hand. The latter arrived to Ethiopia in 1438-39 (bearing the title ʾeṗisqoṗos), together with metropolitans Mikāʾel and Gabrǝʾel (after 1458, there was no bishop in Ethiopia). Cf. S.C. MUNRO-HAY, Ethiopia and Alexandria, vol. 2, Warszawa-Wiesbaden, 2005, pp. 28-36. Additiones 7 and 14 contain references to ʾAbäkäräzun of Gabra Gärzän (ca. 1394-1476).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Additio 6 mentions tǝgre makʷannǝn ʾAkkälom as the donor.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
